name: Prince of Wales Backpacker - Boat Quay

reviews.text: The hostel is quite OK, the best aspects are the location right right in the middle of the action and the beds which are very comfortable. If I could suggest however that they replace the 4mm thick plastic coverings with something that isn't as noisy when you move. I'm a restless sleeper when it's cold and the air-con was turned on too cold, and I'm sure I kept people awake.
reviews.title: Neat and clean, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms are clean but could do with a bit of a renovation and some more pegs or a shelf to hang / put things on while showering.
reviews.title: Cheap for Singapore (and great to go with it)

reviews.text: They go to great pains to ensure there's not a bedbug infestation and signs everywhere tell you how proficient they are in this regard.
reviews.title: Excellent backpackers'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I met some nice people there, the staff is very friendly and helpful. There are lock boxes to store personal effects (bring your own padlock), overall neat and clean. Warning..... Singapore is expensive by standards, I'd imagine this would be great value for money for the location.
reviews.title: Walk on by!

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed for four nights in the Adelaide room (double room in the loft). We had read reviews about noise issues but being as far away from the bar as possible in our room we had no issues at all.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PoW at Boat Quay was a great budget choice in a very lively area of Singapore. We took the private room for two, we had to share a bathroom with one other room but in the two days we stayed there we didn't bump into the guests from the other room once. Rooms were small but very clean, you couldn't open any windows and the one large window looked out onto the large mixed dorm however there was a curtain.
reviews.title: Boat Quay: Great Hostel

reviews.text: The downstairs bar had a great atmosphere with live entertainment both nights we were there. They have good happy hour deals and the food was quite tasty. Boat Quay is a two minute walk to the underground station and so it's a great base for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Hot

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights last week in POW and felt really dissapointed, air conditioner is not working both nights. There's 22 peoples inside dorm and air con is off, can u imagine how hot it is?
reviews.title: A glowing review!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First morning we wait until 9.30am for breakfast and there are no one to prepare breakfast set. Until 10am finally 1 POW staff prepared it. When we checked in, they said their breakfast served 9am.
reviews.title: Stay here and and save some money - Singapore is expensive

reviews.text: Great place, lovely staff, cheap drinks and nice dorms. Definitely the best location to be in downtown Singapore, within a stones throw of all the best night spots and in the shadow of the urban metropolis of Singapore!!
reviews.title: Good location, clean and friendly staff

reviews.text: The original P.O.W in Little India is a laid-back place to grab a meal & a cold beer. Their accommodation is probably the best value for money in Singapore. They regularly have live bands & weekends can be crowded but fun. The new P.O.W on Boat Quay is more up-market, but still a great place to hang with friends & probably a little cheaper than other bars on the expensive dining/entertainment strip. Rooms available here, too.
reviews.title: Great place to hang out in Singapore

reviews.text: I stayed in POW, Boat Quay, from 21-24 June 2012.
reviews.title: Prince Of Wales, Boat Quay, Singapore

reviews.text: The staff on duty - Don and Kent - were most helpful.
reviews.title: Clean and good value singapore hostel x

reviews.text: Thanks guys!
reviews.title: AAA +++ BackPackers + Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The strategic location is just great. So is the view from my dormitory window.
reviews.title: Perfect location, clean room and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Canberra private room a couple of weeks ago at the Little India POW. The location is pretty good, a couple of blocks walk to the Little India subway station which is nice. Air conditioning worked great and the breakfast was...well toast and fruit, not exactly tough to nail.
reviews.title: Average hostel

reviews.text: As for the rest of everything, I was a little disappointed with what POW had to offer. The hostel itself has a cool vibe to it and is probably completely perfect for single people looking to party it up and have a great time. But if you are a couple looking for a cheap place to stay you may want to look elsewhere. The walls were pretty thin meaning you could hear the live music from the bar downstairs, people walking up the stairs to the hostel portion of the building and what seemed like a bollywood movie being shot each night outside on the street. The private shared bathroom was borderline disgusting and a priority is not put on the cleanliness or upkeep of it. The bed was a double bed, which is fine, but was very hard and on a cheap metal ikea frame.
reviews.title: Great vibe

reviews.text: I just had to keep reminding myself that this is in fact a hostel pure and simple but it is tough to go from amazing, cheap accommodation in cambodia and thailand to the POW in Singapore.
reviews.title: Best views in Singapores Boat Quay area. Great live music. Cheap drinks!

reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Little India branch and had a great time.
reviews.title: Lost and found phone and happy staff

reviews.text: The dorms where clean and comfy & the Bar downstairs was good value (for Singapore) & great fun.
reviews.title: Boat Quay

description: The PRINCE OF WALES is Singapore’s only fun-pub backpacker and hostel. We love to see a smile on our backpacker guest faces when they have enjoyed a great night of live music entertainment, half price beers, cocktails and Australian restaurant food. Our backpackers also receive at the Prince of Wales hostel free WiFi, free breakfast, free internet and free lockers. Plus comfy beds, Egyptian cotton.
